alert.note: Alert for Central Chippewa; Eastern Mackinac; Mackinac Island, Bois Blanc Island; Southeast Chippewa; Western Chippewa; Western Mackinac (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued June 24 at 10:10AM EDT by NWS Gaylord
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... The Michigan Department of Environment, Great Lakes, and Energy has declared today, June 24th until midnight to be an Action Day for elevated levels of fine particulate in the Upper Peninsula of Michigan. Pollutants within those areas are expected to be in the unhealthy for sensitive groups range. The action day advisory includes the following counties... Chippewa and Mackinac Smoke originating from wildfires in Ontario, Canada are currently impacting PM2.5 concentrations at the surface across much of the Upper Peninsula. The air quality index is expected to range from the unhealthy for sensitive groups level with some hourly concentrations reaching the unhealthy level. Sensitive groups, such as people with lung disease (including asthma), heart disease, and children and older adults, should limit prolonged or heavy exertion. For further information...please see the Michigan Department of Environment, Great Lakes, and Energy`s Air Quality Index page on the internet at HTTP://WWW.DEQMIAIR.ORG
